Package edu.monash.fit2099

Class AutoShowroom

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.AutoShowroom
public class AutoShowroom extends Object
The brains of the program, inputs and outputs of the program will come from here its attributes consists of scanner, which is used, so it can accept user input, and an array of buyer and vehicle objects

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AutoShowroom()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    createBidders()
    creates a bidder object, which will be given to the vehicle object the bidder was bidding to the vehicle object has a hashmap, where the key is the buyer ID and the value is a bid object so this a is used to make sure the bid is going to the correct vehicle
    void
    createBuyer()
    creates a buyer object which then will be sent to buyerArrayList
    void
    createSedan()
    gives a sedan for the vehicleArrayList
    void
    createTruck()
    gives a truck for the vehicleArrayList
    void
    deleteBid()
    deletes a bid for a vehicle via the bid ID also works similarly to displayHighestBidder, but instead of finding the highest bid price, it will instead extract the bid's ID and compare if the bid ID the user inputs matches and when it does, it deletes that element in the hashmap that has that bid ID
    void
    displayBuyers()
    loops through the buyer array, so they can be shown to the user
    void
    displayFleet()
    loops through the vehicle array, so they can be shown to the user
    void
    displayHighestBidder()
    shows the highest bid for a current vehicle with the bid object being attached to a hashmap in a vehicle object, loops are used to go through all the bid prices and compare with each other to find the highest one
    void
    displayLowestBidder()
    displays the lowest bidder for a vehicle the way this method works is identical to displayHighestBidder, with the only difference being, instead of finding the highest bid price, it finds the lowest on instead
    void
    menuChoices​(int choice)
     
    int
    selectMainMenuItem()
    This method presents the main menu to the user

    • createBidders

      public void createBidders()
      creates a bidder object, which will be given to the vehicle object the bidder was bidding to the vehicle object has a hashmap, where the key is the buyer ID and the value is a bid object so this a is used to make sure the bid is going to the correct vehicle

    • displayFleet

      public void displayFleet()
      loops through the vehicle array, so they can be shown to the user

    • displayBuyers

      public void displayBuyers()
      loops through the buyer array, so they can be shown to the user

    • displayHighestBidder

      public void displayHighestBidder()
      shows the highest bid for a current vehicle with the bid object being attached to a hashmap in a vehicle object, loops are used to go through all the bid prices and compare with each other to find the highest one

    • displayLowestBidder

      public void displayLowestBidder()
      displays the lowest bidder for a vehicle the way this method works is identical to displayHighestBidder, with the only difference being, instead of finding the highest bid price, it finds the lowest on instead

    • deleteBid

      public void deleteBid()
      deletes a bid for a vehicle via the bid ID also works similarly to displayHighestBidder, but instead of finding the highest bid price, it will instead extract the bid's ID and compare if the bid ID the user inputs matches and when it does, it deletes that element in the hashmap that has that bid ID

    • menuChoices

      public void menuChoices​(int choice)
      Parameters:
      choice - - the number inputted from AutoShowroomDriver is processed here depending on what number choice is, it will run any of the 9 methods above
